About

Hiya! I'm Nick, and I'm currently a Senior majoring in Computer Science at UC Berkeley. I have a particular knack for enjoying everything, and therefore picking up random skills everywhere, but I've always enjoyed getting to meet new and amazing people, and making friendships everywhere I go.

This is just a little website that I made so that I can showcase myself in a more 3-dimensional manner, and I invite you to take a look at some of the projects that I have been working on!

I'm looking for internships/jobs once I graduate in December 2021 such that I don't get myself deported as I am quite enjoying my time in the USA (#InternationalStudentStruggles). I've a particular interest in Software engineering and developement, and have picked up skills in Cybersecurity, AI, Database and database management etc... So I think I am quite decent at learning things quickly.

Please feel free to get in touch with me either via the form linked below, or email me at nickplai@berkeley.edu if you have any questions, opportunities, or just wanna sit down, have a chat! I love meeting people, so it'll be my priveledge to get to know you :)

Floorplan Pathfinder

The floorplan pathfinder is a personal project that I worked on under Hackathon conditions to test my coding speed and skills, and is therefore a project I may adapt in the future for mroe practical uses.

Utilising pygame viasualiser, it allows user to upload a floorplan, and then having marked certain floorplan features, utilising modern pathfinding techniques and basic AI, calculates the most efficient route from any given starting location to target destination.

  • Languages/Skills: Python
  • Date: Summer 2021

E@B Website and Mentorship Platform

As the then Co-President of Entrepreneurs@Berkeley and a member of the Technical product team, we had updated the previously static (and rather boring) homepage to a more dynamic design as well as incorporating a brand new mentorship platform designed to connect mentors and product teams on a regular basis. Worked with a team of 3, and maintained and updated the website regularly.

It was a Full-stack Engineering product requiring us to almost completely redesign the front end, and introduce a back-end for the entire website. We used Django to handle much of the back-end which was nice, but fiddling with Bootstrap, AWS, Heroku, HTML and CSS for my first web-designing project was a little tedious.

It's free to use!

  • Languages/Skills: Python, HTML/CSS, Bootstrap, Django, Heroku, AWS
  • Date: Summer 2020
  • Check it out!: Website & Mentorship Platform

Encrypted File Sharing System

As a part of our Cybersecurity course, we were tasked with building an End-to-End Encrypted File Sharing System. Which was good fun and all, allowing me to practice ensuring security while building the back end of an almost-usable product.

It got me practicing some of the common encryption tools such as key-based encryption, Hashing etc... And extensive testing to ensure the absolute security of the platform.

  • Languages/Skills: Golang, Argon2, Hashing, PKE Encryption,
  • Date: Fall 2020
  • Compsci 161: Project Spec

Yelp Maps

The Yelp Maps project completed as a part of the Compsci 61A course. It introduced us to machine learning fundamentals by asking the students to write parts of the algorithm that we use to analyse restaurant and user reviews from the Yelp Academic Dataset.

It was a partner based project for which we used the k-mass algorithm as an example of unsupervised machine learning, enabling us to group, update, and visualise clusters of restaurant recommendations.

  • Languages/Skills: Python, Machine Learning, Voronoi Diagrams
  • Date: Spring 2019
  • Compsci 61A: Project Spec

Machine Learning: Classify

As a part of the Compsci 188: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence course, we coded up the machine learning algorithm required to classify hand-written numbers by building a Neural network and utilising Linear & Non-linear regression.

Was awfully fun to make, and might be one of the projects that actually got me interested in computer vision and machine learning.

  • Languages/Skills: Python, Numpy, Matplotlib, Regression analysis, Neural Networks
  • Date: Spring 2021
  • Compsci 188: Project Spec

Reinforcement Learning: Crawler

As a part of Compsci 188: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence, I was tasked with creating supporting algorithms that dictated the behaviour of a simulated robot Crawler in the context of Pacman.

Required the implementation of some modern reinforcemnet learning techniques such as Value iteration, Policy iteration and Q-Learning.

  • Languages/Skills: Python, Value/Policy Iteration, Q-Learning
  • Date: Spring 2021
  • Compsci 188: Project Spec
